physicsÂ¶

Physics functions as well as constants.

Table of Constants - Fundamental

mp Proton mass in eV.
me Electron mass in eV.
mHe Helium nucleus mass in eV.
hbar hbar in eV s.
c Speed of light in cm/s.
kB Boltzmann constant in eV/K.
alpha Fine structure constant.
ele Electron charge in C.
mass Masses of Standard Model particles.
thomson_xsec Thomson cross section in cm^2.
stefboltz Stefan-Boltzmann constant in eV^-3 cm^-2 s^-1.
ele_rad Classical electron radius in cm.
ele_compton Electron Compton wavelength in cm.

Table of Constants - Cosmology

h h parameter.
H0 float(x) -> floating point number
omega_m Omega of all matter today.
omega_rad Omega of radiation today.
omega_lambda Omega of dark energy today.
omega_baryon Omega of baryons today.
omega_DM Omega of dark matter today.
rho_crit Critical density of the universe in eV/cm^3.
rho_DM DM density in eV/cm^3.
rho_baryon Baryon density in eV/cm^3.
nB Baryon number density in cm^-3.
YHe Helium abundance by mass.
nH Atomic hydrogen number density in cm^-3.
nHe Atomic helium number density in cm^-3.
nA Hydrogen and helium number density in cm^-3.
chi Ratio of helium to hydrogen nuclei.

Table of Constants - Atomic and Optical

rydberg Ionization potential of ground state hydrogen in eV.
lya_eng Lyman alpha transition energy in eV.
lya_freq Lyman alpha transition frequency in Hz.
width_2s1s
bohr_rad Bohr radius in cm.
He_ion_eng Energy needed to singly ionize neutral He in eV.
He_exc_lambda HeI n=1 to n=2 excitation wavelength in cm.
He_exc_eng HeI n=1 to n=2 excitation energies in eV.
A_He_21p Einstein coefficient for 21p -> 1s decay in s^-1.
A_He_23P1 Einstein coefficient for 2^3P_1 -> 1s decay in s^-1.
width_21s_1s_He Width of He 21s -> 1s decay in s^-1.

Table of Methods - Cosmology

hubble(rs[, H0, omega_m, omega_rad, â¦]) Hubble parameter in s^-1.
dtdz(rs[, H0, omega_m, omega_rad, omega_lambda]) |dt/dz| in s.
TCMB(rs) CMB temperature in eV.
CMB_spec(eng, temp) CMB spectrum in number of photons/cm^3/eV.
CMB_N_density(T) CMB number density in cm^-3.
CMB_eng_density(T) CMB energy density in eV/cm^3.
inj_rate(inj_type, rs[, mDM, sigmav, lifetime]) Dark matter annihilation/decay energy injection rate.
struct_boost_func([model, model_params]) Structure formation boost factor 1+B(z)
get_optical_depth(rs_vec, xe_vec) Computes the optical depth given an ionization history.

Table of Methods - Atomic and Optical

alpha_recomb(T_m, species) Case-B recombination coefficient.
beta_ion(T_rad, species) Case-B photoionization coefficient.
peebles_C(xHII, rs) Returns the hydrogen Peebles C coefficient.
C_He(xHII, xHeII, rs, species) Returns the helium C coefficients.
xe_Saha(rs, species) Returns the Saha equilibrium ionization value for H/He.
d_xe_Saha_dz(rs, species) Returns the z derivative of the Saha equilibrium ionization value.
xHII_std(rs) Returns the baseline nHII/nH value.
xHeII_std(rs) Returns the baseline nHeII/nH value.
Tm_std(rs) Returns the baseline Tm value.
photo_ion_xsec(eng, species) Photoionization cross section in cm^2.
photo_ion_rate(rs, eng, xH, xe[, atom]) Photoionization rate in cm^3 s^-1.
coll_ion_xsec(eng[, species]) Returns the collisional ionization rate.
coll_ion_sec_elec_spec(in_eng, eng[, species]) Returns the secondary electron spectrum after collisional ionization.
coll_exc_xsec(eng[, species]) Returns the collisional excitation rate.
elec_heating_engloss_rate(eng, xe, rs) Returns the electron energy loss rate due to heating of the gas.

MethodsÂ¶

darkhistory.physics.hubble(rs, H0=2.1748869673182562e-18, omega_m=0.3175, omega_rad=8e-05, omega_lambda=0.6825)Â¶

Hubble parameter in s^-1.

Assumes a flat universe.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) â The redshift of interest.
  • H0 (float) â The Hubble parameter today, default value H0.
  • omega_m (float, optional) â Omega matter today, default value omega_m.
  • omega_rad (float, optional) â Omega radiation today, default value omega_rad.
  • omega_lambda (float, optional) â Omega dark energy today, default value omega_lambda.
Returns:
Return type:

float

|dt/dz| in s.

Assumes a flat universe.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) â The redshift of interest.
  • H0 (float) â The Hubble parameter today, default value H0.
  • omega_m (float, optional) â Omega matter today, default value omega_m.
  • omega_rad (float, optional) â Omega radiation today, default value omega_rad.
  • omega_lambda (float, optional) â Omega dark energy today, default value omega_lambda.

darkhistory.physics.CMB_spec(eng, temp)Â¶

CMB spectrum in number of photons/cm^3/eV.

Returns zero if the energy exceeds 500 times the temperature.

Parameters:
  • temp (float) â Temperature of the CMB in eV.
  • eng (float or ndarray) â Energy of the photon in eV.
Returns:

phot_spec_density â Returns the number of photons/cm^3/eV.
Return type:

ndarray

darkhistory.physics.inj_rate(inj_type, rs, mDM=None, sigmav=None, lifetime=None)Â¶

Dark matter annihilation/decay energy injection rate.

Parameters:
  • inj_type ({'swave', 'decay'}) â Type of injection.
  • rs (float) â The redshift of injection.
  • mDM (float, optional) â DM mass in eV.
  • sigmav (float, optional) â Annihilation cross section in cm^3 s^-1.
  • lifetime (float, optional) â Decay lifetime in s.
Returns:

The dE/dV_dt injection rate in eV cm^-3 s^-1.
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.struct_boost_func(model='einasto_with_subs', model_params=None)Â¶

Structure formation boost factor 1+B(z)

Parameters:
  • model ({'einasto_with_subs', 'erfc'}) â Model to use. See 1604.02457.
  • model_params (tuple of floats) â Model parameters (b_h, delta, z_h) for âerfcâ option.
Returns:

Boost factor.
Return type:

float or ndarray

Note

Refer to 1408.1109 for erfc model, 1604.02457 for all other model descriptions and parameters.

darkhistory.physics.get_optical_depth(rs_vec, xe_vec)Â¶

Computes the optical depth given an ionization history.

Parameters:
  • rs_vec (ndarray) â Redshift (1+z).
  • xe_vec (ndarray) â Free electron fraction xe = ne/nH.
Returns:

The optical depth.
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.alpha_recomb(T_m, species)Â¶

Case-B recombination coefficient.

Parameters:
  • T_m (float) â The matter temperature.
  • species ({'HI', 'HeI_21s', 'HeI_23s'}) â The species of interest.
Returns:

Case-B recombination coefficient in cm^3/s.
Return type:

float

Note

For HeI, returns beta with respect to the 2s state, in agreement with convention in RECFAST.

darkhistory.physics.beta_ion(T_rad, species)Â¶

Case-B photoionization coefficient.

Parameters:
  • T_rad (float) â The radiation temperature.
  • species ({'HI', 'HeI_21s', 'HeI_23s'}) â The relevant species.
Returns:

Case-B photoionization coefficient in s^-1.
Return type:

float

Note

For HeI, returns beta with respect to the 2s state, in agreement with convention in RECFAST.

darkhistory.physics.peebles_C(xHII, rs)Â¶

Returns the hydrogen Peebles C coefficient.

This is the ratio of the total rate for transitions from n = 2 to the ground state to the total rate of all transitions, including ionization.

Parameters:
  • xHII (float) â The ionization fraction nHII/nH.
  • rs (float) â The redshift in 1+z.
Returns:

The Peebles C factor.
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.C_He(xHII, xHeII, rs, species)Â¶

Returns the helium C coefficients.

These coefficients play a similar role to the Peebles C factor.

Parameters:
  • xHII (float) â The HI ionization fraction nHII/nH.
  • xHeII (float) â The HeI ionization fraction nHeII/nH.
  • rs (float) â The redshift in 1+z.
  • species ({'singlet', 'triplet'}) â The relevant helium C coefficient to return.
Returns:

The C coefficient.
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.xe_Saha(rs, species)Â¶

Returns the Saha equilibrium ionization value for H/He.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) â The redshift in 1+z.
  • species ({'HI', 'HeI'}) â The relevant species.
Returns:

The Saha equilibrium xe.
Return type:

float

Note

See astro-ph/9909275 and 1011.3758 for details.

darkhistory.physics.d_xe_Saha_dz(rs, species)Â¶

Returns the z derivative of the Saha equilibrium ionization value.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) â The redshift in 1+z.
  • species ({'singlet', 'triplet'}) â
Returns:

The derivative of the Saha equilibrium d xe/dz.
Return type:

float

Note

See astro-ph/9909275 and 1011.3758 for details.

darkhistory.physics.photo_ion_xsec(eng, species)Â¶

Photoionization cross section in cm^2.

Cross sections for hydrogen, neutral helium and singly-ionized helium are available.

Parameters:
  • eng (ndarray) â Energy to evaluate the cross section at.
  • species ({'HI', 'HeI', 'HeII'}) â Species of interest.
Returns:

xsec â Cross section in cm^2.
Return type:

ndarray
darkhistory.physics.photo_ion_rate(rs, eng, xH, xe, atom=None)Â¶

Photoionization rate in cm^3 s^-1.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) â Redshift (1+z).
  • eng (ndarray) â Energies to evaluate the cross section.
  • xH (float) â Ionization fraction nH+/nH.
  • xe (float) â Ionization fraction ne/nH = nH+/nH + nHe+/nH.
  • atom ({None,'HI','HeI','HeII'}, optional) â Determines which photoionization rate is returned. The default value is None, which returns the total rate.
Returns:

ionrate â The ionization rate of the particular species or the total ionization rate.
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.coll_ion_xsec(eng, species=None)Â¶

Returns the collisional ionization rate. See 0906.1197.

Parameters:
  • eng (float or ndarray) â Abscissa of kinetic energies.
  • species ({'HI', 'HeI', 'HeII'}) â Species of interest.
Returns:

Collisional ionization cross section in cm^2.
Return type:

float or ndarray

Note

Returns the Arnaud and Rothenflug rate.

darkhistory.physics.coll_ion_sec_elec_spec(in_eng, eng, species=None)Â¶

Returns the secondary electron spectrum after collisional ionization. See 0910.4410.

Parameters:
  • in_eng (float) â The incoming electron energy.
  • eng (ndarray) â Abscissa of kinetic energies.
  • species ({'HI', 'HeI', 'HeII'}) â Species of interest.
Returns:

Secondary electron spectrum. Total number of electrons = 2.
Return type:

ndarray

Note

Includes both the freed and initial electrons. Conservation of energy is not enforced, but number of electrons is.

darkhistory.physics.coll_exc_xsec(eng, species=None)Â¶

Returns the collisional excitation rate. See 0906.1197.

Parameters:
  • eng (float or ndarray) â Abscissa of kinetic energies.
  • species ({'HI', 'HeI', 'HeII'}) â Species of interest.
Returns:

Collisional excitation cross section in cm^2.
Return type:

float or ndarray
darkhistory.physics.elec_heating_engloss_rate(eng, xe, rs)Â¶

Returns the electron energy loss rate due to heating of the gas.

Parameters:
  • eng (ndarray) â Abscissa of electron kinetic energy.
  • xe (float) â The free electron fraction.
  • rs (float) â The redshift.
Returns:

The energy loss rate due to heating (positive).
Return type:

ndarray

Note

See 0910.4410 for the expression. The units have e^2/r being in units of energy, so to convert to SI, we insert 1/(4*pi*eps_0)^2.
